In the current era, ethical theories are often divided between the consequentialist theories of utilitarian philosophers such as [[Jeremy Bentham]] and [[John Stuart Mill]], and [[deontological ethics]] as epitomized by the work of [[Immanuel Kant]]also known as the theory of moral obligation . The late 19th Century also saw the origin of [[pragmatic ethics]] in the United States, especially in the work of [[John Dewey]].Nina Rosenstand(2006:14), states that every functional society on earth has had a "philosophy" of what one should do or be in order to be considered a good person. Ethics in a modern sense can be understood as theories of conduct;thus ethical relativism, Egoism,and Altruism.
